This is a game about a man, his crowbar, and an enduring love for crawl spaces.  

Half Life has aged well, which is a good thing, because we'll all be in retirement homes by the time Half-Life 3 comes out.  It's a classic for a reason...it took a genre that was all crush, kill, destroy, and added a compelling story with more than a little world-building, forever raising the bar.  The mark of an excellent piece of art is its ability to inspire others, and even tired and pathetic tropes like Call of Duty include some semblance of plot now.  You move forward in Half-Life not just because of the thrill of the fight but also because of curiosity, and this increases the immersion greatly.  Half-life was a turning point in the genre...,and, unlike microtransactions, a good one.  If you haven't finished Half-Life, you aren't a PC Gamer, so get on it.  If you've already finished it a dozen times, you'll probably still do another play-through next year.

中配挺好的，耳目一新

******
解謎要素還好，把看到的敵人殺光、慢慢探索所有的路線或是SaveLord大法總是能通關
敵人總是煩躁在麻煩的地方，多來幾次就大概就知道套路了
一開始可能會不習慣操作，玩一段時間就會上手
就算沒有高深的技巧也無所謂，敵人的攻擊很好閃

遊戲前半部有段鑽水管的地方會卡牆，倒退走才能通過
還有遠跳要先改輸入法設定不然跳不起來
遊戲結束畫面出現end1、end2、end3然後就黑畫面了
移動會聽到腳步聲，但完全沒有畫面也無法操作
畢竟是早年的遊戲，小問題

雖然故事還挺不知所云，根據遊戲內容才只知道大概
可能接下來的發展還要打通續作才能明白

half-life 1 
possibly the greatest FPS ever made (sue me COD fanboys) 
when i was a teenager i wasted literally years of time in this game on my old 350Mhz pentium 2 tower with 64MB of RAM in 640x480 res with a 2MB graphics card

this is a classic and no real review is required but for completion sake i will write one anyway 

pros:
this game will run on literally any computer made after 2000 even without a dedicated GPU
multiplayer is fun when you can find someone to play with
the graphics still hold up today in my opinion if you use direct 3D or open GL mode at max res
the level design was exquisite for its time and is still good today 
you get a wide range of weapons to use from the legendary crowbar to an alien beehive 
(did i mention i hate bees!!!)
the gore from falls and explosions (or even the crowbar) is still unmatched in detail by most modern games 
the voice acting is really good for the time 
by adjusting the text in the speech files sometimes you can make characters swear at you
you can even shoot a tanks main cannon and watch alien guts fly everywhere 
the rerplay value is high on this one and i would play it any day 


cons:
it sometimes doesnt work properly on newer computers and operating systems 
most of the time you will have ammo for the guns that are all but useless late in the game 
(ever played shotgun vs helicopter?)
the end boss is near impossible to beat the first time until you look up a walkthrough
the protection missions (protect this scientist from aliens) are hard as shit because tanking is not a useful tactic
headcrabs come out of nowhere before you can shoot them so you WILL take damage 




bottom line: 
get this game 
get this game 
get this game 
why are you still reading this 
get this game 
get this game 
seriously what are you waiting for vote this review as helpful and buy the game its only a dollar or 2

Sencillamente, es un imprescindible si juegas en PC. Un juegazo en toda regla.
Para la época en la que fue publicado destaca muy positivamente en todos los apartados:

-Historia: Por el contrario que sus coetáneos, Half-LIfe se enfoca en la campaña, dejando al multijugador en segundo plano.
El juego nos cuenta las aventuras de Gordon Freeman, un investigador del laboratorio Black Mesa.
Ésta comienza como un día normal en la vida de Gordon, aportando realismo. Pero al realizar un experimento, se abre involuntariamente un portal hacia Xen, lo que provoca que sus habitantes invadan y causen el caos en el laboratorio, dando lugar también a la actuación del gobierno para encubrir el evento.
La historia es bastante consistente, y engancha al jugador a descifrar todos sus misterios. 

-Gráficos: Se caracteríza por usar una modificación del Quake engine, llamada Goldsource, este le confiere unos modelados muy decentes para su tiempo y unas buenas animaciones, exceptuando la repetición de un único modelo para los guardas.
En lo que a efectos y texturas se refiere, se nota el paso de los años, presentando unas texturas en interiores medianamente competentes a día de hoy, pero en exteriores es donde aún se nota más la antiguedad del título, ya que en lugares como el en el desierto, esto es perceptible al observar como están echas las montañas situadas en la lejanía.
Hablando de los efectos, estos siguen notandose antiguos, pero al contrario de las texturas, estos dan mejor la talla.

-Sonido: Half-Life no presenta una banda sonora épica ni memorable, ni falta que le hace, su apertado sonoro destaca por la presencia de efectos de sonido que aumentan la inmersión del jugador en el juego, dando lugar a que éste sienta la soledad que sufre el protagonista en los eventos que acontecen en el título.
Las diversas armas poseen cada una sonidos característicos que las diferencian bien unas de otras, al igual que cada arma, las criaturas que nos atormentan en nuestra travesía poseen sonidos que nos permiten diferenciarlas perfectamente.
El doblaje al español es bastante deficiente, usandose las mismas voces para los científicos y los guardias de seguridad de Black Mesa.

-Jugabilidad: Esta es simplemente excelente, presentando una muy buena curva de dificultad y siendo tremendamente adictiva, presentando una amplia variedad de armas, presentando desde pistolas, hasta lanzacohetes, pasando por armas de rayos.
Los movimientos del personaje responden bien, aunque transmiten una sensación extraña en secciones enfocadas al plataformeo, siendo este un pelín impreciso.
La salud de nuestro personaje se recupera mediante botiquines o máquinas de curación, también presenta indicador de armadura, que reduce el daño recibido en función de como se encuentre de lleno, éste se recupera de la misma forma que la salud.

En definitiva, es un "must have".

This game i good. I would reccomend it, if you like shooters. The graphics aren't good, but the gameplay is great. I liked the weapons in this game more than the weapons in Half-Life 2(excluding the gravity gun). The story is somewhat interesting, but you can ignore it easily by walking away from the character that is talking. I disliked some of the platforming that was in this game because it just becomes tedious and annoying. I got this game for $2.50 on sale, definitely worth it.

its a good game for its age, and has mod support for multiplayer and singleplayer so it's a rather good buy for its price. So if your into classic shooters then this is a great game for you, and if you arent i would still recomend this game for its storyline.

Первая Халфа это:
- это когда тебя накрывает атмосфера ужаса и интриги.
- это когда ты бродишь туда-сюда.
- это когда ты сражаешься с одним солдатом и потерял больше 50% XP.
- это когда ты жёстко пугаешься когда на тебя прыгает Хедкрабик
- это когда ты ломаешь все ящики нахрен.
- это когда ты во время прыжка можешь приседать.
- это когда ты сохраняешься каждую минуту в ручную.
- это когда ты понимаешь что монтировка больно бьёт! 
- это когда тебя будто перенесли в 90-ые.
- это когда солдаты сложнее чем пришельцы.
- это когда ты чувствуешь себя героем впервые убив зомбака :) 
- это когда орёшь увидев перед собой Нихиланта.
- это когда ты понимаешь что Ахтиозавр няшка
- это когда ты плачешь от счастья дойдя до Зена.
- это когда ты с 50-ой попытки прошёл первый уровень на Зене.
- это когда ты тратишь все снаряды и патроны на последнего босса.
- это когда ты узнал, что у Фримена конный хвостик (причёска).
- это когда в онлайне ПОЛНОЕ БЕЗУМИЕ!!!
- это когда в онлайне ты проживёшь максимум пол минуты.
- это когда ты не зря потратил свои деньги.

Ich bin mit hl2 eingestiegen und wollte der sehr guten Story wegen auch den ersten Teil spielen. Ich bin meistens ein Fan älterer Spiele, lege nicht viel Wert auf Grafik sondern viel mehr auf Story, Gameplay und Inhalt. Allerdings bin ich auch keiner dieser Schwachköpfe, die sagen "früher sei alles besser" gewesen und die rein aus Prinzip nur alte Spiele den neueren vorziehen (reiner Zynismus, wenn man mich fragt). Allerdings muss ich mich nun tatsächlich durch den ersten Teil hier quälen. Die damals angepriesenen neue Ära mit Einführung dieses Spiels ist verblasst, die Neuheiten sind (ohne sie mit aktuellen Standards zu vergleichen) relativ schwach und das Spiel kommt ohne große Details aus (und damit sind natürlich nicht die grafischen gemeint). Von daher beende ich es nun vorrangig tatsächlich der Story wegen. Ansonsten macht das Spielen keinen Spaß, der Sound ist schlecht (auch damals konnte man schon gute Klänge nachahmen, nur eben nicht hier), der Spieler bewegt sich mit 20 km/h durch die Welt und das Treffen mit der Waffe scheint nach dem Zufallsprinzip zu verlaufen. Nichtsdestotrotz ist es eben der erste Teil zu meinem Lieblingsspiel, hier begann der Stein zu rollen und wird hoffentlich bald einen dritten Teil anstoßen (man wird ja wohl noch hoffen dürfen).

This is one of the most legendary games in existance. It completely changed the way we looked at FPS games, and set an entirely new standard. And even today, this game holds up pretty damn well. The story is interesting, the gameplay is challenging, and there is a wide variety in level designs. And let's be honest, you are going to have to play this game at some point, if you truly want to call yourself a PC gamer.

So, board your train to Sector C Test Labs and Control Facilities, for you are in for one hell of a journey.

Any PC gamer, old or young, who hasn't played this game, owes it to themself and to PC gaming to beat this game before doing anything else.

While this science fiction classic from 1998 might not be the grandfather of FPS or PC gaming to the tune of DOOM or Wolfenstein 3D, it certainly follows close behind. I would personally classify it as the definitive PC First-Person Shooter of the late 90’s.

In the early 2000s, before I could buy my own PC and was rocking a Compaq Presario 6000 with a Voodoo3 card, I can remember playing what I thought was a demo for this game only to now realize that I was playing the “Half Life: Opposing Force” Demo. You can imagine my frustration when playing through Half-Life in 2016 (Yes, it’s taken me this long to get to it.) while screaming “Where’s the monkey wrench?”

In this game, you play as Gordon Freeman, a 27 year-old doctor on his way to work to analyze crystals from an alien world, but when things go wrong, you have to use whatever you can find at your disposal to escape with many surprises, and betrayals along the way. It’s worthy of a few play-throughs and I personally played through the original release here, the Source Version, and Black Mesa which is a Redo of this game (With the last levels disappointingly missing).

The game is a somewhat linear, basic feeling shooter that involves action, puzzle solving, and a good bit of strategy. This is a game that forces you to think and I recommend keying the quick save and quick load keys to “c” and “v” respectively. There are varied weapons from the signature crowbar melee weapon to alien weapons, aliens AS weapons, and a gun that charges up and blast helicopters out of the sky. 

I appreciate the challenging difficulty that doesn’t hold your hand. It make you take a threat seriously when you can die quickly, something I miss from games of this age.

The prime objective is finding the path out, with many, many enemies in your way.

Classic PC gaming doesn’t get much more iconic than this. Skip Starbucks for a few days and pick this game up.

Half Life é um dos melhores jogos de todos os tempos. Isso é fato, tendo uma história funda e complexa, quando você começa no jogo indo trabalhar como se fosse algo normal, você não imaginaria oque viria depois. A história é muito boa, sondtrack, e  jogabilidade também. Embora o jogo tenha gráficos inferiores aos que vemos hoje, você ainda vai se divertir jogando ele. Recomendo esse para aqueles que gostam de jogos de ficção cientifica (devem checar o Portal também!)

What can be said about this game that hasn't been said already?

I'm writing this review in 2016, eighteen years after this game was released. Having never played a Half-life game, I wanted to jump in with the first in the series, and I was so glad that I did.

Being an older title with dated graphics, gamers today may be quick to overlook this game and head straight for Half-Life 2 and its consecutive episodes. It could be considered a fair decision given how long it was before HL2 came out. It isn't [i]essential[/i] for you to play this game to enjoy Half-life 2; but I'm here to tell you that despite its age, this game still deserves the right to be rediscovered and enjoyed by newcomers. Half-life 2 gives plenty of references to its origin and they'll go over your head if you don't take a look here first.

The game can feel clunky at times. The shooting mechanics see plenty of improvements from Valve in later titles, the AI is dumb, the graphics are bleak and there are very few voice actors- but these are caveats that can be easily overlooked once you are invested in the plot and having fun figuring out how to progress through the levels. Not only that but once you learn a little about the context in which this game was released, you'll forgive it entirely.

It's 1998 and this game busts on to the scene to become the first narrative-driven shooter. Pioneering for its time and provided a benchmark for the genre. Treat your playthrough of this game as a history lesson, let the game transport you backwards in time and afterward you will be left enriched. Do you enjoy using Steam? Valve make great games right? This was Valve's first project. It all began with this game. Play it. If games were like novels this would be required reading.
Bunny hop everywhere and ignore the story completely! I mean, that's what I do...

hola chicos voy a analizar el juego de half life. empezamos en los transportes de black mesa donde nos explican lo que es black mesa y sus reglas, luego de agarrar el traje de proteccion se hace una secuensia de resonansias y tenemos que escapar de black mesa pero la puerta principal es bloqueada y hay que buscar otro lugar para salir. luego el ejercito en vez de ayudar tienen ordenes de matar a todos los testigos y xenianos que se encuentren. luego nos dicen que hay que ir al sector lambda por un sisitema de rieles. al llegar nos mandan a xen para acabar con ellos de una vez, despues de vencer al jefe final aparecera gman un hombre que aparece en varias partes del juego sin acceso rapido y podiendo observarnos, nos da la obsion de haacer un contrato con el, el cual aceptamos.

The game that pioneered storytelling through an RTS engine, provided the platform for thousands of mods and provided the birthing place of the legendary Counter-Strike, and the game that began serving as the namesake of Valve's legacy. All of it began here, with the interactive cinematics, mute protagonists, challenging and diverse stages, and the nuiances that made it feel way better than just running and shooting. I finally beat this game 16 years after it released, and it was still quite good. 

I preferred this version over the Half-Life: Source version greatly, as the other version has a bunch of bugs and not as much multiplayer/mods activity.

I feel like I should give this more but it was a slog running through this game. Sort of a Seinfeld-effect, games nowadays build off of it but now I'm spoiled guess. Lot off cool parts. I'm just not good at utilizing all my weapons for the right situation. Did not care for the platforming aspects and I am glad I had the Gamefaqs Half-Life guide open. Lots of cool parts if I played this when it first came out but I lack that perspective. The 3/5 is how I feel, not how it actually merits in the grand scheme of things.

Although it seems relatively out of place in today's gaming world (low quality graphics and buggy friendly AI) Half Life is a must play for fans of FPS games. It also helps if you don't understand what's happening in the sequel, but not that much. 

8/10 - Amazing game

Half life is Pure art inspired by the great GabeN in the sky. He sent us many steam sales which killed our wallets instantly, and i will be awaiting HL3 so he can decimate our wallets completely with no hopes of recovering. Half life has brilliant level design and simplistic graphics. This is why it is true art. It doesn't require fancy story line or graphics to be fun, It's just fun. similar to megaman and castlevania story isnt important, nor graphics, but the gameplay. Many people today dismiss 8-bit games like them as bad BECAUSE of their graphics, which overall is stupid, obviously. I really wish people played more games like this to show how good games can be without the graphics. (as long as they are pleasing to look at not barphic textures plasted everywhere) Backtracking in this game isnt needed until one part and its actually guided unlike most backtracking, which is excellent level design. Overall Design of the game and levels, fun factory and graphics are great and I look forward to playing more of the Half life series.

Grafika Half-Life 1 samozřejmě není na dnešní dobu nijak nádherná ale na to že hra vyšlaskoro před dvaceti lety je celkem dobrá. Příběh je pěkný i když kvůli absenci titulků (třeba i anglických) mírně nesrozumitelný.  Jedna ze super věcí na HL je rozmanitost úrovní, nepřátel a zbraní. Další věc je že HL1 utáhne téměř jakýkoliv počítač.

Hru bych určitě doporučil.
The game that I grew up with. 10/10

One of my All time favorite games. It had everything i desire from a game in 1998. It is impressive. 

For today's standards, it has aged graphics, but still plays extremely well, and is really entertaining. Story is told mostly via dialogue from other characters, as the main character is mute, well at least in the game(s). I doubt he is really mute if he got a job like that.

You shoot your way through aliens, and soldiers which try to kill everything inside the Black Mesa Facility. Levels are diverse, game is long enough for single player campaign. I love it.

Apart from SP, game has multiplayer modes, which probably isn't that much populated. To compensate that, there are tons of mods for HL1. New gamemodes for MP, new maps, whole new single player games. Just google some of the best mods, and you have so many that you won't know which to play. 

Classic, you should play this if you have not already. If you have, play it again!
If you are turned off by the looks of the game( Which I don't think should be a problem, it's older game)
Look up Black Mesa on steam. It's HL2 Mod, which remade HL1 into HL2's engine, which better visuals and other tweaks.  Black Mesa is still missing the games ending at the moment( Early 2016), but otherwise it's solid example of good remaster.
GREAT GAME

This is one of the games that are just fantastic and epic, this game started a history of games, like Portal series, Team Fortress series, Counter-Strike series, Day of Defeat series and ofcourse the Half-Life series.

I recommend this game for everyone 10/10 :)
also amazing
